src:
Manuel Cruz (PSC) insta l'independentisme a admetre que és responsable de la pujada de Vox
El candidat del PSC a repetir com a president del Senat diu que les declaracions del president en funcions sobre la Fiscalia s'han malinterpretat
07 Nov 2019, 11:13 by Redacció
El president del Senat i candidat del PSC a repetir en aquest càrrec, Manuel Cruz, ha defensat aquest dijous Pedro Sánchez per les seves polèmiques declaracions sobre el seu presumpte control de la Fiscalia.
Segons Cruz, les paraules de Sánchez han estat malinterpretades.
"Jo crec que aquí hi ha hagut un malentès, i, en època electoral, tothom s'ha d'agafar a tot el que hi hagi, i, en aquest cas, unes declaracions que jo crec que han estat malinterpretades." "En cap moment el president del govern en funcions ha parlat com si ell, com a cap de l'executiu, pogués prendre una iniciativa. L'única iniciativa que pot prendre, com se sap, el president del govern és instar la Fiscalia perquè actuï d'una determinada manera."

Sánchez, massa tou?

Preguntat sobre si aquesta i altres promeses de Sánchez signifiquen aixecar el to contra l'independentisme, Cruz ha dit que és "la dreta" qui està fent això.
"Jo crec que el to contra l'independentisme l'està apujant, evidentment, la dreta. Més aviat, la crítica que està rebent Pedro Sánchez és que és massa tou amb l'independentisme."

Vox i l'independentisme

Entrevistat a El Matí de Catalunya Ràdio i a Els matins de TV3, el candidat socialista ha instat l'independentisme a acceptar "una bona part de la responsabilitat" de la pujada de l'extrema dreta.
"Ens hem de plantejar molt seriosament de qui és la responsabilitat del creixement de Vox: si ens creiem l'argument, que es repetia molt des de Catalunya, que l'origen del creixement de l'independentisme era Madrid, ara hem d'acceptar que una bona part de la responsabilitat del creixement de Vox és de l'independentisme. Si acceptem un argument, acceptem l'altre."
 





L'euroordre "desproporcionada" de Ponsatí


"No veig el problema enlloc. Un cop les instàncies judicials britàniques diuen: "perdó, en cap moment vam dir això, en cap moment vam dir que era desproporcionada, això és un error nostre", patacada, cap ni una." "El que s'està transmeten és una imatge deformada si es parla com si Europa fos una unitat dintre de la qual no hi ha cap problema i hi circulen les extradicions lliurement i només és amb Espanya on hi ha problemes."

La carta de Sánchez a diaris europeus

"Existeix una cosa que es diu Diplocat i altres instàncies que es dediquen sistemàticament a fer aquesta publicitat del que fins ara era el procés, i entenc perfectament que un govern o un estat ha d'intervenir si resulta que a l'exterior s'està donant una imatge que aquest estat considera lesiva. Em sembla absolutament normal."

Les trucades de Torra a Sánchez

"La maniobra de dir que ell trucava a Pedro Sánchez i no s'hi posava és manifestament una maniobra de distracció. És a dir, si el president Torra hagués tingut alguna voluntat que a Catalunya no hi hagués hagut la situació de tensió que va haver-hi, no hauria començat des de la universitat de Prada fins fa quatre dies instant a la desobediència, a la confrontació, etc."




Referèndum?

Cruz ha dit que a Catalunya caldrà votar, però no "un referèndum en termes binaris".
"Que en algun moment a Catalunya els ciutadans s'hauran de pronunciar, això és absolutament evident. L'única diferència és que els socialistes sempre han dit que s'han de pronunciar sobre un acord prèviament, al qual han d'arribar les forces polítiques." "Podria ser que la ciutadania rebutgés un acord acceptat per totes les forces polítiques, incloses les independentistes? M'estranyaria molt, perquè aleshores significaria que l'independentisme no té ni el més mínim lideratge sobre els seus electors, i això no m'ho crec."

Sánchez i la penalització dels referèndums

Preguntat per la proposta de Pedro Sánchez d'il·legalitzar els referèndums, Cruz ha recordat que va ser José María Aznar qui va introduir-ho al Codi Penal contra el Pla Ibarretxe, i que ara hi ha motius per tornar-ho a fer.
"Després hi ha hagut governs autonòmics que han convocat referèndums il·legals, i els han convocat dues vegades. Sembla raonable que, si això s'està produint i es considera que és un delicte, és conseqüència de la reiteració de certs comportaments."
text:
Manuel Cruz (PSC) urges independentism to admit that it is responsible for the rise of Vox
The candidate of the PSC to repeat as president of the Senate says that the declarations of the acting president on the Office of the Prosecutor's Office have been misinterpreted
07 Nov 2019, 11:13 by Editorial Staff
The president of the Senate and candidate of the PSC to repeat this position, Manuel Cruz, has defended this Thursday Pedro Sánchez for his controversial statements about his alleged control of the Prosecutor.
According to Cruz, Sánchez's words have been misinterpreted.
"I believe that there has been a misunderstanding here, and, at the election stage, everyone has to take everything there, and in this case, statements that I believe have been misinterpreted." "At no time did the acting president of the government speak as if he, as chief executive, could take an initiative. The only initiative that can be taken, as is known, the president of the government is to urge the Prosecutor's Office because act in a certain way. "

Sanchez, too soft?

Asked about whether this and other promises of Sánchez meant raising the tone against independentism, Cruz said that it is "right" who is doing this.
"I believe that the tone against the independence movement is raising him, evidently, the right. Rather, the criticism that Pedro Sánchez is receiving is that he is too soft with independentism."

Vox and independence

Interviewed in El Mati de Catalunya Ràdio and Els Morns de TV3, the socialist candidate has urged independentism to accept "a good part of the responsibility" of the rise of the extreme right.
"We have to ask very seriously about who is responsible for the growth of Vox: if we believe the argument, that it was repeated very much from Catalonia, that the origin of the growth of independentism was Madrid, now we have to accept that a good part of Vox's growth responsibility is independentism. If we accept an argument, we accept the other. "






The "disproportionate" euroordre of Ponsati


"I do not see the problem anywhere. Once the British legal authorities say:" Sorry, at no time did we say this, at no time we said it was disproportionate, that's a mistake of ours, "" Patacada, no one. " "What is being transmitted is a deformed image if it is spoken as if Europe were a unit within which there is no problem and extraditions circulate freely and it is only with Spain where there are problems."

Sánchez's letter to European newspapers

"There is one thing called Diplocat and other instances that are systematically engaged in making this publicity of what was until now the process, and I fully understand that a government or a state must intervene if it turns out that abroad is giving an image that this state is considered harmful. It seems to me absolutely normal. "

The calls from Torra to Sánchez

"The maneuver to say that he called Pedro Sánchez and did not put himself in is manifestly a distraction maneuver. That is, if President Torra had had any desire that in Catalonia there had not been the tension situation that had occurred -had I would not have started from Prada University until four days ago to disobedience, confrontation, etc. "




Referendum?

Cruz has said that in Catalonia, it will be necessary to vote, but not "a referendum in binary terms."
"That at some point in Catalonia citizens should be pronounced, this is absolutely evident. The only difference is that the Socialists have always said that they have to pronounce on an agreement previously, to which the forces must arrive policies. " "Could it be that the citizens rejected an agreement accepted by all political forces, including the pro-independence parties? I would be very surprised, because then it would mean that independentism does not have the least leadership on its constituents, and that does not happen to me I think. "

Sánchez and the penalty of the referendums

Asked about Pedro Sánchez's proposal to outlaw the referendums, Cruz recalled that José María Aznar was the one who introduced it to the Criminal Code against the Ibarretxe Plan, and that there are now reasons to do it again.
"Then there have been autonomous governments that have called illegal referendums, and have called them twice. It seems reasonable that if this is taking place and is considered to be a crime, it is a consequence of the reiteration of certain behaviors."
